HI

as a practioner of a ryu that has JUTTE I will have to
disagree with you on this one (a little bit), only for
its common know name (see link below for your used
name).

When I was allowed to look in the Kukishin ryu densho
the characters used are 十手

A very close friend of  mine is a member of the Masaki
Ryu In Japan which is famous for its Jutte and edo
machikata jutte, they use the term Jutte (or at least
he does when discussing the matter with me)

http://www.e-budokai.com/hibuki/jutte.htm  this site
has the kanji you use, and its a nice article. 

http://www.geocities.com/koryu-bujutsu/tenjikai/meijiu06.html
 the name Jitte is used here and this is edo machikata
stuff.

Paul
